thread.title: Ashley 'Tugboat' Robinson records video which reveals the 'facts' about Mooloolaba
thread.title_full: Ashley 'Tugboat' Robinson records video which reveals the 'facts' about Mooloolaba | Daily Mail Online

author: Liam Quinn
title: Ashley 'Tugboat' Robinson records video which reveals the 'facts' about Mooloolaba
text:
4
View
comments
A larrikin local has ripped into the story of a pregnant young French woman, Natalie Amyot, who claimed she was looking for the father of her baby, which was revealed to be a marketing stunt.
Ashley 'Tugboat' Robinson, who works at a surf club and bar on the Sunshine Coast, posted a video where he slams the stunt - commissioned by 'Holiday Mooloolaba' - that made headlines around the world.
After starting the video with some clumsy attempts at speaking french, 'Tugboat' launched into his tirade.
Scroll down for video
Ashley 'Tugboat' Robinson, a popular local on Queensland's Sunshine Coast, has ripped into the story of French tourist who claimed she was pregnant and looking for the father
'Can you what Mooloolaba have stooped to try and get busy at Mooloolaba,' Mr Robinson said in the video.
'I cannot believe that they can say they had a pregnant, ten out of ten French tourist looking for a husband, my god.'
 Yes, it's a HOAX: 'Pregnant' French tourist is a paid... Pictured: Horrific foot injuries suffered by pregnant woman... Jewish leaders hit out at Tony Abbott after the Prime... EXCLUSIVE: 'They want girls who look like 10-year-olds':... Mr Robinson then went on to detail some of the perks of the business he is linked with, the Alexandra Headland Surf Life Saving Club.
He cited the views and live entertainment his beloved surf club boasts, before saying: 'There is no fiction. That's a fact.'
In her first video, Natalie Amyot claimed she had holidayed in Mooloolaba on Queensland's Sunshine Coast and spent her last night with a blue-eyed tanned man who she fell instantly in love with
'Can you what Mooloolaba have stooped to try and get busy at Mooloolaba,' Mr Robinson said in the video, in reference to 'Holiday Mooloolaba - the group that commissioned the original viral stunt
'I cannot believe that they can say they had a pregnant, ten out of ten French tourist looking for a husband, my god,' 'Tugboat' Robinson said in the video
Mr Robinson continued in the bizarre video and claimed rugby league star Billy Slater visited to the club earlier in the week.
He then signed off the video by making another dig at the Mooloolaba marketing stunt.
'It is not the French Riveria but it's a fact,' Mr Robinson said about his surf club.
The video comes after it was discovered Ms Amyot's pregancy story was fake.
Natalie Amyot was employed by Sunshine Coast-based company, Sunny Coast Social Media
A day after Ms Amyot posted her video online, another clip was uploaded to her YouTube channel with the 26-year-old coming clean that it was a hoax set up by Sunny Coast Social Media in Queensland.
It opened with the brunette beauty announcing: 'I found him', before stepping aside for owner Andy Sellar.
'This has been a viral video for Holiday Mooloolaba. My name is Andy Sellar and I own a company called Sunny Coast social media,' he said.
The video emerged a day after the original video went live and gained traction across the world
'We do viral videos for businesses. Now I know there is going to be a lot of you that are upset by this... maybe not too happy.
'We just wanted to put Mooloolaba on the map because it's a wonderful place. So thank you for watching and we are going to do many, many more videos like this.'
The announcement confirmed doubts that had been cast over the story of Ms Amyot, who claimed she was searching for a man who got her pregnant on the last night of a three-month trip to Australia.
Online sceptics thought Ms Amyot was in fact former University of the Sunshine Coast student Alizee Michel (left)
A former friend of the fictional Ms Amyot told Daily Mail Australia she was in fact Alizee Michel who is believed to have studied marketing and tourism.
Jordan Foster said Ms Michel had attended the University of the Sunshine Coast - north of Brisbane - for 'a few years'.
'I was on campus of the Sunshine Coast for seven years and was friends with [her] and her friends for a few years because I ran most the functions on campus and off for the university accommodation and my events company that I put together while I was at uni,' he said.
In the video Ms Amyot (above), she had 'an amazing time and met amazing people' before she went off with the 'really cute' Australian man
Ms Amyot posted this photo of Mooloolaba (above) after returning to find the 'really cute' guy she spent the night with, but lost his number in her phone after returning to France where she found she was pregnant
Mr Foster also revealed Ms Michel had a long-term boyfriend who lived with her at Alexandra Headland - a suburb of Mooloolaba - during her time in Australia.
Mr Foster said as far as he knew the 26-year-old was still with her boyfriend last year.
'The story is definitely not true,' Mr Foster added.
Ms Amyot claimed she had spent the night with man after meeting him at O'Malley's pub in Mooloolaba
The 26-year-old made international headlines when she posted a video onto Facebook and YouTube claiming she had returned home only to discover six weeks later she was pregnant following their one-night stand.
Ms Amyot said she had spent 'a beautiful night' with a 'really cute' man and she fell instantly in love.
But her love story immediately drew skepticism from many viewers, with some questioning on social media why the lovestruck woman did not know more about the mystery man - like his name.
